Package com.zoho.arattai.Message

Class VideoMessage

java.lang.Object
com.zoho.arattai.core.Message
com.zoho.arattai.Message.VideoMessage
public class VideoMessage extends Message
Represents a video clip attachment parsed from a WhatsApp chat export.

A VideoMessage is produced for any message whose attachment filename carries one of the following extensions: .mp4, .avi, .mov, .mkv, or .webm.

Duration extraction: the playback duration is parsed from the MP4 container's mvhd (Movie Header) box directly in Java â€” no external tools such as FFmpeg are required. If parsing fails (e.g., the file is corrupt or in an unsupported container), the duration defaults to "0:00".

Pixel dimensions: width and height are set to 0 in the current implementation. They can be populated in a future revision by reading the tkhd (Track Header) box from the video track.

All fields are immutable (public final) and initialised at construction time.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Zoho Arattai
See Also:

  • Field Details

    • videoName

      public final String videoName
      The filename of the video file as stored inside the export ZIP.

    • videoSize

      public final int videoSize
      The uncompressed file size of the video in bytes.

    • videoDuration

      public final String videoDuration
      The playback duration of the video, formatted as "m:ss" (e.g., "2:45"). Defaults to "0:00" when extraction fails.

    • videoType

      public final String videoType
      The lowercase file extension identifying the video container format (e.g., "mp4", "mkv").

    • videoWidth

      public final int videoWidth
      The horizontal resolution of the video in pixels, or 0 if unknown.

      public final int videoHeight

  • Constructor Details

    • VideoMessage

      public VideoMessage(String videoName, int videoSize, String videoDuration, String videoType, int videoWidth, int videoHeight, String sender, Date timestamp, Message.MessageType messageType)
      Constructs a new VideoMessage with all metadata provided by the parser.
      Parameters:
      videoName - the video filename inside the ZIP; must not be null
      videoSize - the file size in bytes
      videoDuration - the playback duration as "m:ss"; must not be null
      videoType - the lowercase file extension; must not be null
      videoWidth - the video width in pixels (0 if undetectable)
      videoHeight - the video height in pixels (0 if undetectable)
      sender - the display name of the sender; must not be null
      timestamp - the date and time the message was sent; must not be null
      messageType - the type classification; expected to be Message.MessageType.VIDEO
